projectGridLines.title: DC EV Charger
projectGridLines.description:
Description: Build AC to DC converters, DC to DC converters, with low voltage and high current

requirement

Skill sets:

Traits expectation:

Expected learning: Building a DC to DC converter requires core skills in electrical engineering

fundamentals, power electronics, and analog and digital electronics. Key knowledge areas include

circuit theory, electromagnetism, switching devices, converter topologies, and control strategies.

Proficiency in mathematics, simulation tools (SPICE, MATLAB/Simulink), and PCB design is essential.

Hands-on skills like soldering, prototyping, and testing are crucial, along with thermal management and

EMC techniques. Understanding safety standards and project management is important. Effective

communication and problem-solving abilities are vital. Learning resources include textbooks, online

courses, and workshops to gain comprehensive knowledge and practical experience.
